feast.sdk.utils.bq_util.get_table_name(feature_id, storage_spec)[source]¶

Get fully qualified BigQuery table name from a feature ID and its storage spec :param feature_id: ID of a feature :type feature_id: str :param storage_spec: storage spec of :type storage_spec: feast.specs.StorageSpec_pb2.StorageSpec :param the feature:

feast.sdk.utils.bq_util.head(client, table, max_rows=10)[source]¶
Get the head of the table. Retrieves rows from the given table at
minimum cost
Parameters:
  • client (google.cloud.bigquery.client.Client) – bigquery client
  • table (google.cloud.bigquery.table.Table) – bigquery table to get the head of
  • max_rows (int, optional) – Defaults to 10. maximum number of rows to retrieve
Returns:

dataframe containing the head of rows
Return type:

pandas.DataFrame
feast.sdk.utils.bq_util.query_to_dataframe(query: str, bigquery_client: google.cloud.bigquery.client.Client = None, storage_client: google.cloud.storage.client.Client = None, project: str = None, templocation: str = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Run a query job on BigQuery and return the result in Pandas DataFrame format

Parameters:
  • query – BigQuery query e.g. “SELECT * FROM dataset.table”
  • bigquery_client –
  • storage_client –
  • project – Google Cloud project id
  • templocation – Google Cloud Storage location to store intermediate files, must start with “gs://”

Returns: Pandas DataFrame of the query result
